message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of detecting and segmenting structures in medical images, which is a common task in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method uses a two-stage 3D fully convolutional neural network, which involves training a model to localize the hippocampus and then segment it. This approach involves deep learning techniques, which are often used in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of the Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC) as a metric for evaluating the segmentation results, which is a common measure in neural networks (cs.NE) and multimedia (cs.MM) research.
